effect.positive: Moderate temperature ensures comfortable handling of objects.
effect.negative: High temperatures may make surfaces or objects hot to touch; low temperatures may make hands less dexterous.

environmental_factors.recommendation: Ensure the environment is at a comfortable temperature for handling objects.

effect.positive: Good lighting improves visibility and makes locating objects easier.
effect.negative: Poor lighting increases the risk of missing objects or picking up the wrong ones.

environmental_factors.recommendation: Ensure adequate lighting in the pickup area, particularly in cluttered or dim spaces.

effect.positive: Stable surfaces help in accessing and picking up objects safely.
effect.negative: Uneven or unstable surfaces may cause objects to shift, increasing difficulty.

environmental_factors.recommendation: Secure objects on stable surfaces before attempting to pick them up.

effect.positive: Moderate airflow has no significant impact on pickup tasks.
effect.negative: Strong airflow may displace lightweight objects, making them harder to pick up.

environmental_factors.recommendation: Avoid performing pickup tasks in areas with high wind or strong airflow.

effect.positive: Low humidity helps maintain object and surface grip.
effect.negative: High humidity may make objects or hands slippery, reducing grip efficiency.

environmental_factors.recommendation: Wipe down objects or hands in high-humidity conditions to improve grip.

effect.positive: Quiet environments improve focus and precision.
effect.negative: Loud noise can distract the individual, leading to errors or dropped objects.

environmental_factors.recommendation: Perform pickup tasks in a quiet or noise-controlled environment.

effect.positive: Clean surfaces allow objects to be easily accessed and picked up.
effect.negative: Dust or debris may obscure objects or make surfaces slippery.

environmental_factors.recommendation: Keep pickup areas clean to ensure ease and safety.
